definition: child's buttocks (esp. Cantonese)/(onom.) crack, slap, clap, clatter etc

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat

sentences.english: Pigeons lifted from the roofs in a clatter of multicolored wings.
sentences.chinese: 鸽子在天花板下噼里啪啦地向上扑腾五颜六色的翅膀。

sentences.english: Making pitter-patter sounds on my glass window.
sentences.chinese: 在玻璃窗上弄出噼里啪啦的声音。

definition: variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
lit. splitting the head and covering the face (idiom); fig. pelting (with rain etc)/showering down
